A morning of crowds, procession and ceremony.
An official welcome at Wellington's Town Hall and a visit to the War Memorial.
Then it's on to Parliament buildings,
where Sir Arthur will be sworn in
to the office he's to hold for the next five years.

and commander-in-chief in and over New Zealand and that I will duly and impartially administer
justice therein. So help me God.

the oath is signed in the presence of the Chief Justice,
and Sir Arthur Porritt becomes our 11th Governor-General. Are you ready now?

With the increasing diffusion of the Maori people through the cities,
opportunities for getting together in large national gatherings are now infrequent.
An occasion such as this is a valuable chance to meet other people, to renew acquaintances and to cement friendships.
For the young people especially it emphasizes the ties that bind together the
Maori community. For those elders who still remember the past it provides a
nostalgic even sad awareness of the gradual erosion of early tradition and custom. This is also a time for us.

The Maori land bill always arises mixed feelings on the part of those involved.
Mari art, like the Maori way of life itself,
represents something quite different from what it was even one generation ago.
The continuing effect of Pākehā influences on traditional music making
has resulted in a form that bears resemblance to both,
but still remains different from either.
It's a new and hybrid form.

On this last day of the festival,
everyone makes a pilgrimage to the site of an historic power on the summit of Mount
Monganoi, the peak which lies just across the harbor from Tarong.
The interdenominational service commemorates the landing of the great fleet in this
country, Air Tiaroa, over 600 years ago.
I'd like to say something to give you understanding how we came on this spot.
We left Hawaii in the year 1350 and landed here on the same year and reoccupy this ground.
And several canoe landed in different places.
One Taki Tum landed in here, the next Teara was landed at Makitu
and then the other one, Matao landed in Fakatane.
